docs.abstract: Major League Baseball takes unusual step of filing lawsuit in Florida court, accusing six people connected to South Florida anti-aging clinic Biogenesis of America of damaging sport by providing various players with prohibited substances.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets are one of the major league teams using a Doppler radar unit to track the movement of a baseball out of a pitcher’s hand and off a hitter’s bat.
docs.abstract: New York Mets are one of few major league baseball teams that are using Doppler radar to track exact movements of ball after it is pitched; technology, created by Danish company TrackMan, is said to allow more in-depth analysis of pitching style.

headline.seo: Mets, Like Others, Turn to Technology to Try to Gain an Edge
headline.main: Mets’ Latest Weapon, So They Hope

docs.snippet: A  film review  on Friday about “Gimme the Loot” misidentified the baseball stadium featured in the movie and misstated the time period. The stadium is the Mets’ current home, Citi Field, not their previous one, Shea Stadium (...
docs.lead_paragraph: A film review on Friday about “Gimme the Loot” misidentified the baseball stadium featured in the movie and misstated the time period. The stadium is the Mets’ current home, Citi Field, not their previous one, Shea Stadium (although characters in the film call the new stadium “Shea”). Thus the action does not take place in the summer before Citi Field replaced Shea Stadium.

docs.snippet:
The Baltimore Ravens, the defending Super Bowl champions, will open the season on the road because the N.F.L. and Major League Baseball could not work out a scheduling conflict with the Baltimore Orioles.
   
Since 2004, the N.F.L. has sta...
docs.lead_paragraph:
The Baltimore Ravens, the defending Super Bowl champions, will open the season on the road because the N.F.L. and Major League Baseball could not work out a scheduling conflict with the Baltimore Orioles.
 
Since 2004, the N.F.L. has staged its season opener – along with concerts and other festivities – at the home of the Super Bowl champion, usually on the Thursday night before the first full weekend of the regular season. But on that night this year, Sept. 5, the Baltimore Orioles open a four-game series at home against the Chicago White Sox. Because the Ravens and the Orioles share some parking lots, their games cannot overlap. And because Sept. 4 is the start of Rosh Hashana, the N.F.L. decided it would not play that night.

headline.main: Ravens to Open on the Road
